data.title: Boston & Lowell and Nashua & Lowell Railroad. Schedule Broadside. March 24, 1857 by Boston & Lowell and Nashua & Lowell R.R.: Very Good Sheet (1857) Signed by Author(s)
data.meta_description: Signed by Author(s) - Sheet - Pathfindor Printing Rooms, Boston - 1857 - Condition: Very Good - Folio. 1 page. 16 x 11 inches. Printed in blue on cream-colored thick paper, no folds, no losses, no chipping, only a few small stains. Large vintage antebellum broadside announcing the rail schedule / timetable on and after April 1st, 1857. Signed in print by John B. Winslow, Sup't. The Boston & Lowell was an early railroad company, its first tract was completed in 1835. The quantity of passengers on the Boston and Lowell Railroad was large from the start (as it was expected). Moreover, freight traffic was important as Lowell's textile companies would bring in raw materials and send out finished goods. Service in the towns of Boston, Wilton, Nashua, Lowell, Manchester, Concord, Billirica, Tewksbury, Wilmington, Woburn, Winchester and Medford. Scarce. - Boston & Lowell and Nashua & Lowell Railroad. Schedule Broadside. March 24, 1857
data.text:
Shipping Terms:

Les commandes sont généralement expédiées dans les 2 jours ouvrables. Les frais d'expédition sont basés sur des livres pesant 2,2 lbs ou 1 kg. Si votre commande de livres est lourde ou surdimensionnée, nous pouvons vous contacter pour vous informer si des frais de livraison supplémentaires sont nécessaires.

Orders usually shipped within 2 business days. Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 pounds or 1 kg. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know if extra shipping is required.
